text: Fennel (Foeniculum vulgare) is a kind of herb. It is native to the Mediterranean and some parts of Asia. Its bulb, leaves, and seeds may be eaten. Dried fennel seeds are used as a spice for flavoring food. Fennel was used to make the spiced wine, claret, in the Middle Ages. Their flavor is like anise. == Images == Image:Foeniculum vulgare.JPG|Fennel leaves Image:Fennel CDC.jpg|Fennel bulb and stalks Image:Fennel seed.jpg|Fennel seeds == Other websites == * Fennel - nutrition and uses Category:Herbs Category:Spices Category:Apiaceae
title: Fennel
